intro: Loasa illapelina, commonly known as the Illapel loasa, is a flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Loasa illapelina is often found in coastal and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
